result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES:  15CM156, 16CM66, 17CM28, 17CM99, 17TR1612, 17TR1613
Defendant Scout T Calabria in court with attorney Daniel Repka.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:15 p.m.   AO-Clerk.  

17CM99 - Counts 3, 4 & 5, NC plea.  Ct accepts  pleas, de adj guilty.  Counts 1 & 2 dismissed.
17TR1612 - De - NC plea.  De adj. guilty.  
All other charges & pending files DRI including charges that may not be yet filed.

SENTENCE:  

17CM99 -    W/H 18 mo. probation to run concurrent. No abusive contact with Alicia Brousil or Rebecca Pollock.  Absolute sobriety.  $243.00 for each count and  DNA surcharge of $200.00 for all each count. Total of $1329.00.  Must report to probation within 24 hours.  60 DTP or set up PP w/ COCC.
17TR1612 - $811.50, 6 month loss of driving priv., retroactive to date of administrative suspension, to complete AODA- follow through any therapy or treatment.

PCR. 3:45 p.m. adj.
Status conference on September 14, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Scout T Calabria in court, with attorney Dan Repka appearing by phone.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB- Clerk. 223pm Br 1 cannot hear 17CM99. Br 1 disq on other files. Other files are with Judge Lundell. Today Atty Nemmers was at SCC- SCC has taken care of both Judge Lundell files as to stayed warrants and scheduling. CT quashes warrant. Def plans to retain Atty Repka- Atty Repka stand in for today. Def wishes it to be reassigned with Judge Lundell. JA to process case reassignment. Bond to be taken up at next hearing. 233pm adj.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
